content:
• Thursday, February 23, 2017
  • ACHC

    Acadia down 9% after hours on Q4 revenue miss

    • Acadia Healthcare (NASDAQ:ACHC) Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 702.9 (+41.9%). Consensus view was $708.4M.
    • Net Income: 41.8 (+20.8%); Non-GAAP Net Income: 51.3 (+21.3%); EBITDA: 122.4 (+22.4%); Non-GAAP EBITDA: 149.5 (+33.7%); EPS: 0.48 (-2.0%); Non-GAAP EPS: 0.59 (unch); Cash Flow Ops (full year): 361.5 (+50.4%).
    • 2017 Guidance: Revenues: $2.85B - 2.90B; Non-GAAP EBITDA: $625M - 640M; Non-GAAP EPS: $2.40 - 2.50.
    • Q1 Guidance: Non-GAAP EPS: $0.45 - 0.47.
    • EPS decreased 2% primarily due to the issuance of stock related to the Priory Group acquisition.
    • The addition of Priory accounted for most of the revenue growth.
    • Shares are down 9% after hours on modest volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • OLED

    Universal Display +13.3%; Q4 2016 over expectations, first-ever dividend declared

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $74.57M (+19.7% Y/Y, $5.97M above estimates), EPS $0.55 ($0.13 above estimates), net income $25.8M (vs. $18.1M Y/Y), operating income $34.8M (+31%), cost of sales $9.1M (vs. $8.1M), operating expenses $30.7M (vs. $27.6M)
    • Other developments – Quarterly cash dividend declared of $0.03 per share, payable March 31, 2017 to shareholders of record March 15, 2017.
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $230M-$250M (consensus $243.88M)
    • Universal Display EVP and CFO Sidney Rosenblatt: "Looking forward, we see extremely positive momentum in our business and believe that we are well positioned to capture the tremendous opportunities in front of us. With our bustling customer pipeline, we have broadened and further increased the depth of our R&D team to respond to the exciting challenges and opportunities in the marketplace for today and tomorrow. We have the innovation, commitment to operational excellence, agility and flexibility to drive the invention and development of the best OLED technologies and phosphorescent materials for our customers and partners worldwide."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:OLED) $76.45
    • Conference call / press release / 10-K
     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM
  • VISN

    VisionChina Media facing petition to wind up company

    • Out-of-home advertising firm VisionChina Media (VISN -14.6%) has gotten a petition from former shareholders of Digital Media Group asking for an order to wind up the company.
    • The shareholders are Gobi Fund, Gobi Fund II and Gobi Ventures. Digital Media Group was acquired by VisionChina for $160M in cash and stock in January 2010, a move that built China's biggest mobile TV ad network.
    • The Grand Court of the Cayman Islands has set a hearing date for the petition of March 2. VisionChina says it's consulting with counsel to resolve the issue, but day-to-day operations continue normally.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • DFT

    DuPont Fabros sets $200M 'at the market' share offering program

    • DuPont Fabros (DFT +2.4%) has dipped 0.9% after hours following the announcement of an "at the market" share offering program.
    • Under the plan, the company might issue and sell up to $200M worth of common shares, to be sold in at-market offerings or in private transactions.
    • Any proceeds would be earmarked for general purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:34 PM
  • INCY

    Incyte, CBOE Holdings, Regency Centers to join S&P 500

    • Incyte (NASDAQ:INCY) +4.1% AH as the stock, along with CBOE Holdings (NASDAQ:CBOE) and Regency Centers (NYSE:REG), will join the S&P 500.
    • INCY will replace Spectra Energy effective at the open of trading on Feb. 28, while CBOE will replace Pitney Bowes (NYSE:PBI) on March 1 and REG will replace Endo International (NASDAQ:ENDP) effective March 2.
    • PBI and ENDP will drop to the S&P MidCap 400; Nu Skin (NYSE:NUS), Dillard's (NYSE:DDS) and CyrusOne (NASDAQ:CONE) also will join the index, replacing Equity One (NYSE:EQY), Intersil (NASDAQ:ISIL) and CLARCOR (NYSE:CLC).
     
     
     
     
    | 6:10 PM | 7 Comments
  • LEAF

    Leaf Group logs mixed Q4 as Marketplaces takes lead

    • Leaf Group (LFGR) jumped into the close (ending up 3.7%) ahead of its after-hours earnings report, which showed mixed results for the former Demand Media.
    • Revenues that were formerly more of an even split tilted heavily toward the company's Marketplaces segment. Revenue overall fell 1%; eliminating the impact of disposition of the Cracked business and other "nonstrategic" properties, revenue was up 9%.
    • EBITDA loss got wider, to -$2.6M from -$0.9M, and free cash flow fell into negative territory (-$0.4M vs. a positive $0.7M a year ago). Cash and equivalents at the end of the quarter was $50.9M against no debt.
    • Revenue by segment: Marketplaces, $22.6M (up 22.8%); Media, $11.4M (down 29.2%).
    • After hours: LFGR -0.6%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM
  • AAOI

    Applied Optoelectronics +10.8%; Q4 2016, outlook positive

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $84.9M (+60.3% Y/Y, $1.32M above estimates), EPS $0.84 ($0.09 above estimates), gross margin 38% (vs. 29.5% Y/Y, 33.1% Q/Q), net income $15.5M (vs. $3.9M Y/Y, $7M Q/Q)
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $87M-$91M (consensus $74.65M), EPS $0.80-$0.88 (consensus $0.40), gross margin 38%-40%, net income $15.5M-$17.2M
    • Applied Optoelectronics founder, president and CEO Dr. Thompson Lin: "AOI achieved another record year driven by strong demand for our market-leading datacenter products and continued execution by the AOI team. We believe our record performance further demonstrates our growing market share in advanced optics and our team’s ability to generate manufacturing efficiencies that lead to margin improvement. Our ability to internally manufacture lasers and light engines provides us with cost-leadership advantages, a faster time to market, and the ability to quickly scale to demand. Looking ahead, as the 100G transition accelerates this year, we see the opportunity to build on our momentum and expand our market leadership."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:AAOI) $41.51
    • Conference call / press release / trended quarterly financial results / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM
  • MTZ

    MasTec beats by $0.16, beats on revenue

    • MasTec (NYSE:MTZ): Q4 EPS of $0.70 beats by $0.16.
    • Revenue of $1.34B (+30.1% Y/Y) beats by $30M.
    • Shares +5.4% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: RH +15.3%. OLED +12.4%. AAOI +10.8%. BJRI +5.8%. INCY +3.9%.
    • Top losers: ACIA -15.7%. ZOES -10.6%. ACHC -8.9%. ALDR -8.7%. HCLP -7.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 10 Comments
  • ACHN

    Achillion -5% after earnings, outlook, share sale plans

    • Alongside its Q4 results, Achillion Pharma (NASDAQ:ACHN) files a mixed shelf for up to $250M of varying securities, including 18.4M shares to be sold by Johnson & Johnson.
    • Turning back to the Q4 report, the company is guiding the 2017 loss to $0.70-$0.75 per share vs. Street estimates for $0.36.
    • Shares down 4.95% after hours.
    • Previously: Achillion Pharmaceuticals beats by $0.15 (Feb. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • BRCD

    Brocade -2.8% as revenue slips from Q3, drives miss

    • Brocade Communications (NASDAQ:BRCD) is 2.8% lower now in aftermarket trading after a miss in its Q4 earnings, as revenue that was up slightly Y/Y fell 12% sequentially.
    • There's no guidance or call, with Brocade set to be acquired by Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO). But the company swung to a loss of $0.01/share in GAAP terms, and non-GAAP EPS fell to $0.16 from $0.29.
    • Revenue breakout: Product, $480.6M (down 0.1%); Service, $100.85M (up 8.3%). Gross margin fell to $367.1M from $388.8M.
    • SAN product sales fell 12% to $307M, mainly due to lower Fibre Channel director and embedded switch sales, the company says. Alternative storage architectures benefited alongside customer uncertainty about the acquisition.
    • Meanwhile, IP Networking revenue of $174M was up 30% with the help of $72M in revenue from Ruckus Wireless -- now being sold to Arris for $800M, after it acquired Ruckus for about $1.2B last spring.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 3 Comments
  • HPE

    Hewlett Packard Enterprise -6.5%; Q1 2017 revenue, outlook off

    • Q1 2017 results – revenue $11.4B (-10.4% Y/Y, $670M below estimates), EPS $0.45 ($0.01 above estimates), operating margin 9.2% (vs. 8.1% Y/Y), net earnings $0.8B (vs. $0.7B Y/Y), cash flow from operations -$1.5B (vs. -$75M Y/Y)
    • Segment revenues – Enterprise Group $6.3B (-12% Y/Y), Enterprise Services $4B (-11% Y/Y), Software $721M (-8% Y/Y), Financial Services $823M (+6% Y/Y)
    • Q2 2017 projections – EPS $0.41-$0.45 (consensus $0.47)
    • FY 2017 projections – EPS $1.88-$1.98 (reduced from $2-$2.10; consensus $2.05)
    • Outlook commentary – "Three significant headwinds have developed since Hewlett Packard Enterprise provided its original fiscal 2017 outlook at its Securities Analyst Meeting in October 2016: increased pressure from foreign exchange movements, higher commodities pricing, and some near-term execution issues."
    • Hewlett Packard Enterprise president and CEO Meg Whitman: "I believe HPE remains on the right track. The steps we're taking to strengthen our portfolio, streamline our organization, and build the right leadership team, are setting us up to win long into the future."
    • After hours – (NYSE:HPE) $23.05
    • Conference call / press release / presentation / summary / results / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • AGO

    Assured Guaranty beats by $0.37

    • Assured Guaranty (NYSE:AGO): Q4 EPS of $1.05 beats by $0.37.
    • Revenue of $470M (-39.4% Y/Y)
    • Shares +1.5% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • CXW

    CoreCivic and GEO Group on the move as Sessions reverses Obama prison order

    • The new attorney general says the Bureau of Prisons will "return to its previous approach to the use of private prisons."
    • CoreCivic (NYSE:CXW) +3.7%, GEO Group (NYSE:GEO) +1.75% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 68 Comments
  • RH

    Restoration Hardware beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Restoration Hardware (NYSE:RH): Q4 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $590.14M (-8.8% Y/Y) beats by $6.68M.
    • Shares +14%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACIA

    Acacia Communications -17.6%; Q4 2016 above expectations, Q1 outlook at issue

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $142.4M (+107.7% Y/Y, $2.68M above estimates), EPS $0.94 ($0.04 above estimates), gross margin 48.3%, income from operations $46M, net income $39M, adjusted EBITDA $48.6M
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $108M-$114M (consensus $137.36M), EPS $0.63-$0.70 (consensus $0.78), net income $27M-$30M
    • Acacia Communications president and CEO Raj Shanmugaraj: "Our solid fourth quarter results were driven by continued strong global demand for our 100G and flex-400G products from the metro and DCI markets and the ramp of our newer customers, and we are very pleased to report that we added a hyper-scale cloud and content provider, who is a direct customer deploying our AC400 product, as a significant customer in the fourth quarter. We are committed to our mission of delivering high-speed optical interconnects that transform cloud, content and communication networks.  We are already seeing good traction with our latest “industry first” product, the CFP2-DCO module, and we believe that our current product offerings, roadmap products, and development pipeline, position us well to take advantage of future growth opportunities."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:ACIA) $52.27
    • Conference call / press release / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 33 Comments
  • NCMI

    National CineMedia -3.5% on lighter 2017 guidance

    • National CineMedia (NCMI -2.7%) has fallen another 3.5% in postmarket trading after a Q4 earnings beat that featured lightweight guidance for the full fiscal year.
    • Revenue rose 4.5% and adjusted OIBDA gained 14.9% to a record $86.4M, above consensus expectations for $81.5M.
    • Revenue breakout: National advertising, $96.4M (up 8.6%); local and regional advertising, $39.3M (down 3.2%).
    • Ad revenue per attendee rose to $0.824 from $0.708, and total revenue per attendee gained to $0.865 from $0.746, though attendance dipped Y/Y, to 164.7M from 182.8M.
    • It's guiding to full-year revenue growth from -0.5% to 4% ($445M-$465M, below consensus for $477.6M), and adjusted OIBDA growth from -2% to +4% ($225M-$240M, below expectations for $245.1M).
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • BIDU

    Baidu beats by $0.02, misses on revenue

    • Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU): Q4 EPS of $0.93 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $2.62B (-2.6% Y/Y) misses by $50M.
    • Shares +1.3%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 15 Comments
  • HCLP

    Hi-Crush Partners unveils $415M in acquisitions, 20.5M-share offering

    • Hi-Crush Partners (NYSE:HCLP) -6.5% AH after announcing acquisitions totaling $415M: the Permian Basin Sand Co. from a third party, the Whitehall proppant facility from HCLP sponsor Hi-Crush Proppants, the remaining 2% additional interest in Hi-Crush Augusta from Hi-Crush Proppants, and additional properties located near the Whitehall facility.
    • HCLP says the deals will transform its production mix and strengthen cash flow in the near-term and over the long-term; during H2 2017, HCLP says it will operate 13.4M tons of low-cost production across sand grades and types.
    • To fund the deals, HCLP launches a public offering of 20.5M common units, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 3.075M units.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 26 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk -7.7%; Q4 2017 over expectations, Q1 revenue outlook light

    • Q4 2017 results – revenue $306.5M (+39.3% Y/Y, $18.28M above estimates), EPS $0.25 ($0.08 above estimates), operating income $35.8M, operating margin 11.7%, operating cash flow $102.5M, free cash flow $84.4M
    • Q1 2018 projections – revenue $231M-$233M (consensus $241.42M), operating margin -2% to -4%
    • FY 2018 projections – revenue $1.185B (consensus $1.18B), cloud revenues $85M, operating margin 8%
    • Splunk president and CEO Doug Merritt: "Customer success is our number one priority. More than 13,000 organizations worldwide depend on Splunk, including nearly 700 new customers this quarter. It is early in our data and analytics journey – it is a big market with a tremendous opportunity that Splunk is uniquely positioned to win. We are confident in our long-term strategy to become the ubiquitous machine data platform for our customers."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:SPLK) $59.90
    • Conference call / press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 19 Comments
  • OLED

    Universal Display beats by $0.13, beats on revenue

    • Universal Display (NASDAQ:OLED): Q4 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.13.
    • Revenue of $74.57M (+19.7% Y/Y) beats by $5.97M.
    • Shares +9.35%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • BJRI

    BJ's Restaurants beats by $0.15, beats on revenue

    • BJ's Restaurants (NASDAQ:BJRI): Q4 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.15.
    • Revenue of $265.62M (+14.0% Y/Y) beats by $1.21M.
    • Shares +6.31%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • NAO

    Nordic American offshore to launch 33.33M-share offering

    • Nordic American Offshore (NYSE:NAO) -9.7% AH after announcing a public offering of 33,333,333 common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 5M shares.
    • The underwriters have reserved for sale ~$10M to Nordic American Tankers (NYSE:NAT), NAO's largest shareholder, and ~$2M worth of common shares to NAO Executive Chairman Herbjorn Hansson and his son.
    • NAO says it plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes, working capital purposes and the expansion of its fleet.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 49 Comments
  • HLF

    Herbalife beats by $0.03, revenue in-line

    • Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q4 EPS of $1.00 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $1.05B (-4.5% Y/Y) in-line.
    • Shares +1.8%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 14 Comments
  • ICPT

    Credit Suisse's Young scratching head over Intercept's sell-off

    • The approximately 18% sell-off in Intercept Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ICPT) since Friday's peak of $132.25 has Credit Suisse's Alethia Young perplexed. She says Q4 Ocaliva sales beat expectations and the launch trends are positive. She adds that the timelines for the NASH remain on track.
    • She rates the stock Outperform with a $198 (71% upside) price target.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 10 Comments
  • JWN

    Nordstrom beats by $0.12, misses on revenue

    • Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q4 EPS of $1.27 beats by $0.12.
    • Revenue of $4.32B (+3.1% Y/Y) misses by $30M.
    • Shares +3.55%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 6 Comments
  • STZ

    Positive talk by POTUS on border tax rattles retail sector

    • Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) ended the day with a late 4.14% slide on concerns over comments made by President Trump to Reuters on an adjusted border tax.
    • "It could lead to a lot more jobs in the United States," said Trump.
    • Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT), Anheuser-Busch InBev (NYSE:BUD) and Target (NYSE:TGT) also broke lower after the Reuters story broke.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 47 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK): Q4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $306.5M (+39.3% Y/Y) beats by $18.28M.
    • Shares +1.4%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 10 Comments
  • REN

    Resolute Energy +5.5% as proved reserves rise 82%

    • Resolute Energy (REN +5.5%) is on the rise after reporting an 82% Y/Y increase in its proved reserves to 60.3M barrels at year-end 2016, consisting of ~73% crude oil, 14% natural gas and 13% natural gas liquids.
    • REN says it produced an average of nearly 14.2K boe/day in FY 2016, above the high end of company guidance, with a year-end exit rate of more than 20.8K boe/day, with 71% coming from the Permian Basin; REN says it also met or beat the midpoint of guidance for lease operating expense and production taxes.
    • REN also says it closed on a new $150M credit facility, up from $105M previously, and extended the maturity date to February 2021.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • NTT

    NTT taking over remainder of RagingWire Data Centers

    • NTT Communications (NTT +0.5%) is taking 100% ownership of RagingWire Data Centers, with plans to purchase the remaining shares.
    • Alongside those plans, RagingWire is making changes at the top, as founder George Macricostas moves from chairman/CEO to the executive chairman's role, and current president Douglas Adams will become RagingWire CEO.
    • RagingWire sports a portfolio with more than 1.2M square feet and nearly 100 megawatts of critical power.
    • Full control of RagingWire will bring the company more closely into the NTT umbrella of data-center firms, which includes Netmagic Solutions in India, Gyron Internet in Europe and an extensive portfolio in Asia.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum’s assets, debt reduction make it a Buy, Canaccord says

    • Whiting Petroleum (WLL +3.1%) is reiterated with a Buy rating and $14 price target at Canaccord, saying the company has quality assets, has cleaned up its balance sheet and has the capability to ramp up activity quickly.
    • The firm notes that WLL completed 25 new wells in the Williston Basin during Q4 that produced for 30 or more days, and argue that while spending will double this year, the big impact will be felt in 2018 production.
    • Canaccord says WLL deserves credit for reducing long-term debt by 42% since the end of Q1 2016; since the beginning of 2015, the company sold $725M of non-core assets, which “along with innovative debt exchanges and free cash flow drove the debt reduction.”
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 20 Comments
  • PAVM

    PAVmed readies exchange offer; shares up 9%

    • Ultra-thinly traded PAVmed (PAVM +9.3%) rallies on a 4x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 25K shares, in response to its pending exchange offer of New Units for common stock on a 1:1 basis.
    • Each New Unit will consist of one common share and one warrant to purchase one share of common at $6. The warrants are exercisable between October 31, 2018 and April 30, 2024. The company has the option to redeem all of the warrants if the common stock trades at or above $18, subject to conditions, after April 30, 2019.
    • The New Unit warrants are identical to certain warrants issuable in connection with its February 2, 2017 private financing.
    • The securities in the New Units will become separately tradable one year after closing.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • HGG

    Bankruptcy warning on hhgregg

    • Bloomberg reports that hhgregg (HGG -5.7%) is prepping for a bankruptcy filing.
    • Sources indicate that a filing could arrive within a month.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 8 Comments
  • FL

    Investors cautious on Foot Locker ahead of earnings

    • Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) is due to report earnings tomorrow before the bell. Analysts expect the company to disclose revenue of $2.12B and EPS of $1.32.
    • The company is expected to post its guidance during the earnings call. Consensus estimates are for Q1 EPS of $1.54 and FY17 EPS of $5.27.
    • Foot Locker is expected to show some strength as retro and casual trends play into its favor in footwear and apparel.
    • Shares of Foot Locker are down 2.91% into the earnings read amid a rough day for mall retailers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • GRMN

    Garmin -2.7% as analysts react to earnings with caution

    • After logging gains of 7.3% yesterday following its earnings beat, Garmin (GRMN -2.7%) is retrenching today and analysts are looking cautious and staying neutral.
    • Morgan Stanley reiterated an Equal Weight rating as Garmin guided toward slowing growth in key categories: 10% and 5% growth in Outdoor and Fitness, vs. the 31% and 24% of a year ago. "While Garmin should continue to do better than Fitbit due to the former’s app store, wider selection, high-end Fenix line and stronger presence internationally, Garmin is still facing a slowing wearables market."
    • The firm raised its price target to $47, implying 11% downside from today's price.
    • Dougherty (Neutral) was "surprised to see management stick their neck out there and call for 5% Y/Y revenue growth in Fitness" against a 300-bp headwind coming from foreign exchange and comparing a 52-week year to a 53-week year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • CM

    CIBC gains 1% after earnings beat, dividend hike

    • Q4 (ended Jan. 31) EPS of C$2.89 topped analyst estimates by $0.30.
    • Barclays' John Aiken calls the beat not necessarily of the highest quality, but its size alongside the 2.4% dividend increase should be enough for investors.
    • EPS was helped along by a $0.62 gain from the sale and leaseback of branches, says Desjardins Capital's Doug Young.
    • Capital markets was particularly strong, with profit of $371M nearly tripling that of a year ago.
    • CEO Victor Dodig says CIBC (CM +1.2%) remains committed to the purchase of PrivateBancorp (PVTB -0.9%), though the current share price of about $57 is well north of his bank's offer. Both parties can walk away from the deal anytime up to June 29 without suffering a penalty.
    • If the deal doesn't come through, there's always buybacks, and CIBC is seeking approval to buy back up to 2% of the float over the next 12 months.
    • Previously: Canadian Imperial Bank declares CAD 1.27 dividend (Feb. 23)
    • Previously: Canadian Imperial Bank beats by C$0.30 (Feb. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • RIG

    Transocean +7% after Q4 beat; says drilling market bottom is near

    • Transocean (RIG +7.4%) surges after easily beating Q4 earnings and revenue expectations, and saying its contract backlog was $11.3B as of its February fleet status report.
    • The Q4 beat was driven by higher than anticipated revenues and lower than expected costs of $344M, well below company guidance of $375M-$385M; for the second consecutive quarter, RIG delivered revenue efficiency in excess of 100% and EBITDA margins surpassing 50%.
    • RIG says improving market fundamentals along with a steady flow of customer inquiries are raising confidence that the offshore drilling market trough is near.
    • However, Raymond James analysts reiterate their Underperform rating on the stock following the report, praising RIG’s ongoing cost controls and strong revenue efficiency while still unable to recommend the stock amid a difficult macro backdrop.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 8 Comments
  • NAK

    Northern Dynasty +18% as House committee asks EPA to rescind Pebble veto

    • Northern Dynasty Minerals (NAK +18%) surges after disclosing that the U.S. House Committee on Science, Space and Technology has recommended that the EPA rescind the agency's 2014 regulatory action that vetoed its Pebble Project.
    • NAK says the letter provides impetus for the new EPA chief to take timely action to return the Pebble Project to normal course permitting.
    • The stock price had been sliced by more than half following last week's negative report from Kerrisdale Capital Management, which said NAK shares were "worthless" and the Pebble deposit "is not commercially viable."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 39 Comments
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney preview: Expect volatility

    • Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP -0.5%) could be volatile tomorrow with the company due to report earnings in the morning.
    • Bloomberg Intelligence reports that options trading implies a 10% move in JCP up or down after the print. Also keep in mind that short interest represents +30% of J.C. Penney's outstanding float.
    • Analysts expect revenue of $3.98B and EPS of $0.61 from the retailer for the holiday quarter, although the guidance issued for FY18 could be the main event.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 18 Comments
  • APA

    Apache -4% after posting wide Q4 miss

    • Apache (APA -4.3%) is sharply lower after reporting a surprise Q4 loss amid lower production, as the company remained focused on costs in a "volatile price environment."
    • APA says it earned an average of $47.39/bbl of oil during Q4, compared to $39.79 in year-earlier quarter, as costs and expenses fell 77% Y/Y.
    • Q4 oil and gas production averaged 420.8K boe/day (64% liquids), down 14% Y/Y, with oil and natural gas liquids totaling 271K bbl/day and natural gas coming in at 898.6M cf/day.
    • APA plans a 2017 capital budget of $3.1B, up 60% Y/Y, while also aiming to grow production by ~10% in the next year.
    • APA anticipates H1 2017 production will decline due to scheduled downtime for the annual maintenance turnaround in the North Sea, scheduled downtime for plant maintenance in Canada, and natural declines as a result of reduced investment in lower-margin North American onshore regions.

  • ONCS

    OncoSec's ImmunoPulse shows treatment effect in mid-stage melanoma study; shares ahead 3%

    • Thinly traded nano cap OncoSec Medical (ONCS +3.3%) perks up on a 4x surge in volume in response to its announcement of positive results in a Phase 2 open-label study assessing the combination of ImmunoPulse IL-12 and Merck's (MRK +0.8%) Keytruda (pembrolizumab) in metastatic melanoma patients who are not expected to respond to PD-1 inhibition alone.
    • The data showed an overall response rate at week 24 of 43% (n=9/21) and a best overall response rate of 48%. There were five complete responders, four partial responders and two with stable disease, implying a disease control rate of 52% (n=11/21).
    • A Phase 2 registration study in patients who failed anti-PD-1 therapy alone is on tap for later this year.
    • ImmunoPulse IL-12 delivers a pulsed electric field to cells via a hand-held applicator which temporarily increases the porosity of the cell membranes (electroporation). DNA IL-12 is then delivered to the electroporated cells which triggers each cell to produce and secrete IL-12 protein which then identifies and eliminates cancer cells as part of a natural immune response.
    • Pembrolizumab helps the immune system fight tumor cells by blocking the interaction between PD-1, a cell surface receptor expressed on T cells and pro-B cells, and its ligands PD-L1 and PD-L2. PD-1 is an immune checkpoint which down regulates the immune system. Blocking its action activates the immune system to attack cancer cells.
    • Previously: OncoSec Medical's ImmunoPulse IL-12 shows positive effect in PD-L1 inhibitor-resistant melanoma patients; shares up 7% (Nov. 8, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 30 Comments

    Tesla hits reverse as earnings and Musk talk digested

    • Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) is now down 6.01% after the company's conference call last night didn't quite hit all the burning questions on the minds of investors.
    • Wall Street shops are mainly backing their prior views with a wave of reiterated ratings. Cowen (Underperform, $155 PT) calls out the "phantom" EPS beat and warns on cash needs. Baird (Outperform, $368 PT) thinks the CFO transition is a positive and points to the better-than-feared Model 3 progess and SolarCity integration.
    • Of course, Morgan Stanley analyst Adam Jonas is in with a forward-looking take on Tesla.
    • "While we don’t believe the company’s long term value will be dependent on selling machines for private use, we do see the Model 3 as an important step in its effort to introduce data-harvesting, machine-learning devices that accelerate a network of shared, autonomous and electric transport," writes Jonas. "While we are still in early days of the migration to Auto 2.0, we cannot at this stage identify any other firm who is as advanced in the state of the art of this discipline as Tesla," he adds.
    • SA contributor Mark Hibben had it right when he pointed out that this earnings report will do little to separate the big divide between Tesla skeptics and proponents.
    • Shares of Tesla are at their lowest level since February 8, but are still up 21% YTD.
    • Previously: Tesla outlines Model 3 timeline and Gigafactory growth (Feb. 22)
